thread.title: South Carolina women sell more than 10,000 season tickets
thread.title_full: South Carolina women sell more than 10,000 season tickets

title: South Carolina women sell more than 10,000 season tickets
text:
South Carolina women sell more than 10,000 season tickets Tools 
Story Created: Oct 26, 2015 at 1:00 PM   26, 2015 at 2:00 PM EDT 
COLUMBIA, S.C. (AP) â€” South Carolina has gotten a fast start to leading the nation in attendance for a second straight year. 
The school said Monday the women's basketball team has sold more than 10,000 season tickets for the upcoming season, an increase of nearly 2,000 over last year's total. The Gamecocks topped the country in attendance last season, averaging 12,293 people in 2014-15. 
South Carolina has gone 32-0 the past two seasons at the 18,000-seat Colonial Life Arena. 
Gamecocks coach Dawn Staley said the community support is a motivator for the team to keep working hard and win games. 
South Carolina was 34-3 last season. It reached its first Final Four this past April. 
The Gamecocks open the season Nov. 13 at home against Ohio State.
